Darrel Miller wrote:
> On Thu, Sep 17, 2009 at 2:44 PM, Bill Burke <bburke@...> wrote:
>> The client is guaranteed that a set of link relationships will exist
>> within the order-entry representation because of the schema backing the
>> media type. Machine-based clients (at least those that are application
>> driven) can't guess how to traverse links. They have to know ahead of
>> time what to do.
>>
> 
> Often you do not want to guarantee that all of the links will exist.
> The client needs to adapt to the availability of the links that it
> knows about.  In an order processing scenario you would not want to
> provide a link to "process" the order until all of the required
> information is entered, and you would not want a "cancel" link until
> after the order has been submitted.
> 

+1 see my other response...It was just an idea anyways...

Bill

-- 
Bill Burke
JBoss, a division of Red Hat
